data.title: Everything They Promised
data.text: My teenage son and I decided to squeeze in paddle boarding while staying at Hammock Beach resort. Only about 10 minutes away from the resort - very convenient. Called day before (Saturday morning) for Sunday morning reservation. We arrived a little early but no wait for the official open time. Signed our releases, a few instructions and off we went. I am a novice paddle border, unlike my son, so we didn't venture too far. Mostly stayed in the canals of the adjoining neighborhood. Probably would have seen more wildlife if we used the intercostal to adventure into other areas. Great way to start your day - peaceful, slow paced and on the water. Two hours was just the right amount of time. Anything longer and we would have been exhausted for the rest of our day. I will build my strength so next time we can adventure up the intercostal - we are planning on a next time.

data.title: Great time for families!
data.text: My family and I rented two tandem kayaks for a couple of hours and we had a blast.  Even though it was hard work, we saw a lot of wildlife (Dolphins, osprey, fish, etc) and had a couple good laughs at our struggles to steer the kayaks (user error I am sure haha). We reserved the kayaks so when we got there we simply had to sign a waiver, get a quick briefing on how to steer, a description of the route, and we were off!  When we got back we enjoyed a cold drink that we bought from the gift shop (very cheap drinks and snacks) before heading back to the condo!  Great experience!

data.title: Fun Palm Coast Adventure!
data.text: My kids and I had a great time today with our kayaks rented from Tropical Kayaks.  My son, 16 got a single kayak and my daughter, 11, and I shared a tandem kayak.  It was super fun.  Go early in the day before it gets too hot.  We saw turtles, crabs, interesting birds and fish.  We will definitely do this again!

data.title: Back to nature
data.text: Spent 2 hours kayaking the Intracoastal  and canals. Very quiet and up close with manatee. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable. Great trip!

data.title: Had a good time.
data.text: The owner met us at the door as we walked in the shop. She was a very nice women. After giving us some pointers and directions she sent us on our way. We searched for the manatees but didn't have any luck. The paddle back up the canal was a real workout. Great experience though.

data.title: Fun Time
data.text: We hoped for a more wooded area and less causeway kayaking, but we still had fun.  Disappointed we didn't see any dolphins or manatee, maybe because it was mid afternoon? Not sure, but still glad we went,  beautiful in the creek area.

data.title: First Timers!!
data.text: Our first time ever going kayaking! Meg, and her staff made us feel very comfortable! Even though it was a bit windy that day and had to fight the current... We still had a blast! We will do again but on a less windy day!

data.title: Manatees!
data.text: This is a good option on the plan coast for both a beginner and intermediate kayaker . They have two main routes, one a little shorter takes you to a nice little inlet and the other, longer in miles and time takes you through mangroves. There is resident manatee that is known the visit the kayakers. On our trip we were lucky to enough to have her visit us several times, popping her head up. The kids loved it. The folks renting are very knowledgeable and take the time to walk you through things, especially if you are a beginner. We plan on visiting the area again this spring and will return to do the mangrove route. Experts may a bit bored, but give them a call, my guess is they have a variety of maps based on level.

data.title: Intercoastal kayaking
data.text: Fun kayaking along the Intercoastal. We took a short trip into an alcove and saw some jumping fish. Operators are very nice. Call ahead and reserve, can get busy.

data.title: Paddling fun
data.text:
Suggest you to rent from this organization for a few hours if terrific fu.  Owner is generous with a quick education and to set you out for some fun paddling, even for total novices.  
 I always rent from them when I have house guests. We always see sometimes g interesting when we go out on the intercostal!

data.title: Paddleboarding in Paradise
data.text: Paddleboarding on the waterways of Palm Coast was serene. Meg gives you a quick demonstration, some good tips and then you are on your way.  As a first timer, I wasn't sure I could do it, but it turned out to be very easy. Very reasonably priced and the equipment is in excellent shape. Everything provided including a life preserver. We went back the next week and rented kayaks.

data.title: Very fun and very beautiful
data.text: Go early in the am before the wind!  You will likely see dolphin and manatee in the summer, and heron and egrets and Ospreys. Great prices and friendly service

data.title: Suitable for all!
data.text: The whole family had a great time on the kayaks. Didn't see much wildlife but it was a good experience and felt like a workout too! Meg very friendly and helpful.

data.title: Great prices and friendly owners
data.text: We've been kayaking several times and really enjoy the experience, this was our first time kayaking in this area. When we arrived we were greeted by the owners, super nice and easy going. Provided us with a map and gave us two different routes we could take. We went out on the intracoastal and then to a small inlet past all the boat docks. I'll be honest, we were not expecting all the boat traffic and it kind of took away from the peacefulness of kayaking. Lots of boats speeding by, big boats. Once we made it past the boat docks and went down the small inlet it was all good. Not much to see down that way but it was fun going under all the downed trees. There is a small area on the right when you first get on the intracoastal that has sand and big trees you can sit on. It's a great place to stop and have a snack on the way out or back in. I don't think we'll be back to this area for kayaking but the owners were very nice and the kayaks were in great condition. They do their best to put you in a kayak based on your size. If you don't mind all the boats, check them out.

data.title: So much fun!
data.text: My husband and I went out early in the morning and we were not disappointed. The owner said to look out for dolphins and manatees and we saw them! Keep a close lookout, they come out of nowhere. Absolutely worth our money!

data.title: Ruined the part of our trip we most looked forward to!
data.text: We had made our reservation for 3 kayaks for a fishing day with friends. They weren't keen on us taking the kayaks to bings because of low tide having shallow oyster beds. However, they didn't say no. The only thing we were finalizing was whether we were going to pick up the kayaks sat night or in the morning. When we called to let them know we were coming to get them sat night, they told us they released them to someone else because we hadn't confirmed which is complete... Horse manure. They messed up and should have made it right by honoring our reservation. If they had to, they should have called the 2nd group to tell them they made a mistake.  Horrible. Now we are stuck with no kayaks for something we've been planning!

data.title: Low price, great service, fun experience
data.text: I have wanted to try paddle boarding for a while, so while on vacation at Flagler Beach, it seemed Tropical Kayaks was the best way to go. Meg was great; she gave us an overview of how to paddle board and some safety tips and sent us on our way. $20 for a couple of hours in quiet waters... a good workout but also relaxing. You won't go wrong with Tropical Kayaks!

data.title: Friendly service
data.text: My teenage kids and I rented kayaks on a morning when the weather was supposed to get worse later The owner advised a tandem kayak for my sons, and suggested a route based on expected winds. We had a great time exploring a little creek as well as the Matanzas River. We're from Minnesota and we know our boats. Great experience!

data.title: Nice People
data.text: Rented bikes for a week.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  They installed a carrier basket; provided free helmets and lock!  Offered free backpacks.  Bikes are simple and well maintained with VERY comfortable seats. Bike hiked for a few hours today...very pleased.  Simple paperwork to rent!

data.title: Fantastic Place!
data.text: My wife and I went for a brief morning getaway while family watched our kids. We were on the area visiting family on vacation.   I've been wanting to Paddle Board for years and Tropical Kayaks did not disappoint!   The price was super reasonable, staff was so helpful and friendly.   We plan on coming back each time we visit Palm Coast!
